PROGRAM PLAMMING COMM I TTEE
Kenneth Wright reports that the members of this committee have
conferred by mail on program ideas for the network© We recommend con¬
sideration of aprestige series such as "Ways of Mankind" was, and sug¬
gested that the Oe Tocqueville scripts be considered. We are further
agreed that trying to originate programming concepts, specific areas
for programs, and specific programs to fit the areas for a network is
not a Job to be undertaken by three people in Iowa City, New York, and
Knoxville. Programming by committee is a big fat headache, of course,
even if the committee can get together; it’s nearly impossible when the
committee doesn’t meet0
Wright attended a meeting in Chicago with Chairmen of the
Grant-in-Aid, Acceptance, and In-School Acceptance Committees, along with
Skornia and Bob Hudson to discuss this year’s grant in aid program. The
master title of AMERICA IN THE TWENTIETH CENTURY for the grant applicants
was suggested by Wright, so this committee can claim credit for originat¬
ing it.
Wright has also submitted a monthly radio program Idea as per
Schooley’s suggestion for the NAEB News-Letter for about three or four
months now. This will continue, since suggestions are being received
from members.
RADIO NETWORK COMMITTEE
The chairman of the Joint Committee has successfully acted with
diligence and efficiency to evade any mental or physical exertion.
Waldo Abbot, Chairman
Network Acceptance Committee
